RuleSet.description: Consumers who make a Complaint to a Supplier will be treated with fairness and courtesy, and their Complaint will be dealt with objectively and efficiently by the Supplier.
RuleSet.displayName: Telecommunication Consumer Protections Code C628.2012: Section 8.2: Complaint Management

Term.description: Supplier believes complaint can be resolved within 25 working days of acknowledging the complaint.
Customer advises Supplier of their special circumstance that may affect handling of their Complaint.
Customer raised credit-related complaint
Term.atom: topic of complaint is on credit

Term.description: Supplier provides confirmation of resolution in written form within 5 days of closing the complaint
Supplier writes to customer at their last known address, stating that they were unable to contact them.
Supplier has offered a proposed Resolution to a Customer for their Complaint.
Supplier provides written document informing customer of reasons Supplier is not proceeding to resolve the complaint.
Customer is dissatisfied with progress of a Complaint.
Supplier has informed customer of internal escalation process.
Supplier closes the complaint.
Supplier offers remedy to a Complaint to a Customer.
Supplier implements a remedy for a general problem indicated by a complaint.
Supplier has delay in resolving a complaint
Customer directly contacts staff via telephone to raise a complaint (i.e. does not need to leave a message).
Customer is dissatisfied with proposed Resolution by Supplier.
Supplier informs customer of delays to promised timeframes.
Customer raises complaint that is indicative of a wider general problem.
Term.atom: complaint topic indicative of general problem

Term.description: Supplier sends invitation to customer to contact supplier with a timeframe of greater than 10 days for contact.
Term.atom: send invitation with timeframe greater than 10 days

Term.description: Customer accepts offer of proposed Resolution
Supplier informs customer of its internal prioritisation process for complaints.
Supplier fixes error in the current billing period
staff are aware of potential remedies available to resolve a complaint
Supplier implements resolution within 2 working days of receiving the complaint.
Supplier and Customer agree on a resolution date different to the standard 10 working days after acceptance of proposed resolution.
Supplier informs customer of timeframe for resolution of complaint.
Supplier identifies an immediate resolution is available for a complaint.
Supplier chooses not to deal with the customer any more.
Supplier acknowledges complaint by customer.
Remedy exists for the root cause of a Complaint.
Remedy exists for complaints where the customer has a special circumstance.
means a Complaint made to a Supplier by a Customer about any aspect of the Customerâ€™s Bill or the Supplier's Billing.
Supplier notified customer of outcome of complaint less than 7 days ago
Customer raises a complaint via a phone number provided by the Supplier
Customer asks to pursue complaint further with Supplier.
Supplier offers a remedy to resolve a Complaint that has special circumstances.
Supplier deems a complaint frivolous or vexatious
Supplier resolves complaint by the agreed upon custom resolution date.
Supplier provides a means for the customer to monitor progress of a Complaint.
Supplier sends a list of contact attempts to the customer as part of the written 'no contact' message.
Supplier initiates legal proceedings to resolve a Complaint.
Supplier resolves a complaint
Supplier can resolve complaint within 2 working days.
Supplier has not been able to contact customer about their complaint.
Customer requests written confirmation of resolution when complaint is closed.
Supplier informs customer of options for external dispute resolution.
Supplier completes all necessary actions to resolve complaint within 10 working days of the customer's acceptance of the resolution
Complaint has been investigated.
Supplier has identified billing error has cause of complaint.
Supplier receives a complaint in person.
Supplier resolves a complaint on first contact with the customer.

Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself, where a response or Resolution is explicitly or implicitly expected by the Consumer.
Supplier checks if the complaint is urgent as defined in TCPC.
Supplier is waiting on a customer to perform actions before a complaint can be resolved.
Customer is satisfied with resolution
Customer is dissatisfied with the timeframe of the proposed Resolution from the Supplier.
Supplier identifies complaint as urgent
Supplier identifies root cause of a complaint affects a large number of customers.
staff in charge of complaint / technical staff
Supplier acknowledges a complaint within 2 working days
Supplier checks for a resolution to the complaint during first contact with the customer.
Customer raises complaint with a root cause that needs to be rectified.
Customer agrees that the complaint can be closed.
Supplier believes complaint can be resolved within 15 working days.
A remedy exists for a general problem highlighted by a complaint.
Supplier has complied with TCPC clause 8.2.1.e in attempting to contact the customer about their complaint.

Supplier performs credit management action, which may include Supplier assisting customer to manage their expenditure on telecommunication services, manage credit risk to supplier, collect outstanding debts from customers.
Supplier executes internal prioritisation process on a complaint (including determining its urgency).
Supplier acknowledges a complaint immediately e.g. acknowledgement during phone call when the Customer raises the complaint.
Supplier informs customer reasons for delay in resolving a complaint.
Customer contacts supplier within specified timeframe in invitation to contact.
Supplier informs customer of proposed resolution within 15 days of receiving the complaint.
Complaint is escalated for resolution.
Supplier has complied with TCPC clause 8.2.1.c informing the customer about internal and external escalation processes.

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier must delay commencement of any legal proceedings for 7 Working Days after Consumer is advised of the outcome of their Complaint
Rule.LegalRepresentation: delaying commencement of any legal proceedings while a Complaint is being handled internally and for 7 Working Days after Consumer is advised of the outcome of their Complaint
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),notification sent less than 7 days(X),resolution(X) => [OM]-initiate legal proceedings(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier must delay commencement of any legal proceedings while a Complaint is being handled internally.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: delaying commencement of any legal proceedings while a Complaint is being handled internally and for 7 Working Days after Consumer is advised of the outcome of their Complaint
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),investigated(X) => [OM]-initiate legal proceedings(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must not take Credit Management action in relation to a specified disputed amount that is the subject of an unresolved Complaint in circumstances where the Supplier is aware that the Complaint has not been Resolved to the satisfaction of the Consumer and is being investigated by the Supplier, the TIO or a relevant recognised third party.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: not taking Credit Management action in relation to a specified disputed amount that is the subject of an unresolved Complaint in circumstances where the Supplier is aware that the Complaint has not been Resolved to the satisfaction of the Consumer and is being investigated by the Supplier, the TIO or a relevant recognised third party
Rule.FormalRepresentation: -customer satisfaction(X),investigated(X),resolution(X),topic of complaint is on credit(X) => [OM]-credit management action(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must not take Credit Management action in relation to a specified disputed amount that is the subject of an unresolved Complaint in circumstances where the Supplier is aware that the Complaint has not been Resolved to the satisfaction of the Consumer and is being investigated by the Supplier, the TIO or a relevant recognised third party
Rule.LegalRepresentation: not taking Credit Management action in relation to a specified disputed amount that is the subject of an unresolved Complaint in circumstances where the Supplier is aware that the Complaint has not been Resolved to the satisfaction of the Consumer and is being investigated by the Supplier, the TIO or a relevant recognised third party
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-resolution(X),topic of complaint is on credit(X) => [OM]-credit management action(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must resolve billing errors in the the current billing period.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: resolving Billing errors in current Bills
Rule.FormalRepresentation: billing complaint(X),billing error(X) => [OAPNP]fix error current billing period(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If the Supplier has attempted but failed to make contact after performing the actions described in TCPC clause 8.2.1.e (written message to customer at last known address, state that they were unable to contact the Consumer, provide details of those contact attempts and provide an invitation to contact the Supplier to Resolve the Complaint within a specific timeframe of no less than 10 Working Days.), the Supplier is considered to have complied with TCPC section 8.2.1.e
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If the Supplier has attempted but failed to make contact after performing the actions described in TCPC clause 8.2.1.e (written message to customer at last known address, state that they were unable to contact the Consumer, provide details of those contact attempts and provide an invitation to contact the Supplier to Resolve the Complaint within a specific timeframe of no less than 10 Working Days.), the Supplier is considered to have complied with TCPC section 8.2.1.e
Rule.FormalRepresentation: -contact within timeframe(X),send invitation with timeframe greater than 10 days(X),send list of contact attempts(X),send written no contact message(X) => complied821e(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If Supplier is unable to contact a Consumer to Resolve their Complaint, they must sent an invitation to contact the Supplier to discuss the Complaint within a timeframe of no less than 10 working days.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If a Supplier is unable to contact a Consumer to Resolve their Complaint, or to advise them of the outcome of their Complaint, the Supplier must write to the Consumer at their last known address, state that they were unable to contact the Consumer, provide details of those contact attempts and provide an invitation to contact the Supplier to Resolve the Complaint within a specific timeframe of no less than 10 Working Days.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),no contact(X) => [OAPNP]send invitation with timeframe greater than 10 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If Supplier is unable to contact a Consumer to Resolve their Complaint, they must provide details of those contact attempts in the written message to the Consumer.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If a Supplier is unable to contact a Consumer to Resolve their Complaint, or to advise them of the outcome of their Complaint, the Supplier must write to the Consumer at their last known address, state that they were unable to contact the Consumer, provide details of those contact attempts and provide an invitation to contact the Supplier to Resolve the Complaint within a specific timeframe of no less than 10 Working Days.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),no contact(X) => [OAPNP]send list of contact attempts(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If a Supplier is unable to contact a Consumer to Resolve their Complaint, or to advise them of the outcome of their Complaint, the Supplier must write to the Consumer at their last known address, state that they were unable to contact the Consumer
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If a Supplier is unable to contact a Consumer to Resolve their Complaint, or to advise them of the outcome of their Complaint, the Supplier must write to the Consumer at their last known address, state that they were unable to contact the Consumer, provide details of those contact attempts and provide an invitation to contact the Supplier to Resolve the Complaint within a specific timeframe of no less than 10 Working Days.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),no contact(X) => [OAPNP]send written no contact message(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: For a frivolous or vexatious complaint, a Supplier is not then required to accept further Complaints from that Consumer on the same issue other than in the course of an external dispute resolution process.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: frivolous or vexatious(X) => -complaint(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If, after careful consideration and appropriate internal escalation, a Supplier concludes that a Complaint is frivolous or vexatious and that it can do nothing more to assist the Consumer or that, in view of the Consumerâ€™s behaviour, it chooses not to deal with the Customer any further, it must inform the Consumer about the options for external dispute resolution including the TIO.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If, after careful consideration and appropriate internal escalation, a Supplier concludes that a Complaint is frivolous or vexatious and that it can do nothing more to assist the Consumer or that, in view of the Consumerâ€™s behaviour, it chooses not to deal with the Customer any further, it must inform the Consumer in writing of the reasons and tell them about the options for external dispute resolution including the TIO. A Supplier is not then required to accept further Complaints from that Consumer on the same issue other than in the course of an external dispute resolution process.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: escalation(X),frivolous or vexatious(X),no further assistance(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If, after careful consideration and appropriate internal escalation, a Supplier concludes that a Complaint is frivolous or vexatious and that it can do nothing more to assist the Consumer or that, in view of the Consumerâ€™s behaviour, it chooses not to deal with the Customer any further, it must inform the Consumer in writing of the reasons.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If, after careful consideration and appropriate internal escalation, a Supplier concludes that a Complaint is frivolous or vexatious and that it can do nothing more to assist the Consumer or that, in view of the Consumerâ€™s behaviour, it chooses not to deal with the Customer any further, it must inform the Consumer in writing of the reasons and tell them about the options for external dispute resolution including the TIO. A Supplier is not then required to accept further Complaints from that Consumer on the same issue other than in the course of an external dispute resolution process.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: escalation(X),frivolous or vexatious(X),no further assistance(X) => [OAPNP]inform reasons not to proceed(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier can be deemed as compliant with TCPC clause 8.2.1.c if the customer remains dissatisfied with the resolution, has been informed for internal escalation and external dispute resolution, and has consented to close the complaint.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer consent close case(X),customer dissatisfied resolution(X),inform external dispute resolution(X),inform internal escalation process(X) => complied821c(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier can be deemed as compliant with TCPC clause 8.2.1.c if the customer remains dissatisfied with progress of resolution, has been informed for internal escalation and external dispute resolution, and has consented to close the complaint.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer consent close case(X),customer dissatisfied progress(X),inform external dispute resolution(X),inform internal escalation process(X) => complied821c(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who asks about their options to pursue the complaint further about options for external dispute resolution including the TIO.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who asks about their options to pursue the complaint further about options for external dispute resolution including the TIO.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer asks pursue complaint further(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who asks about their options to pursue the complaint further about the internal escalation process.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who asks about their options to pursue the complaint further about the internal escalation process.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer asks pursue complaint further(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about resolution of a complaint the options for internal escalation.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about resolution of a complaint the options for internal escalation.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about resolution of a complaint the options for external dispute resolution.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about resolution of a complaint the options for external dispute resolution.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about progress of complaint resolution the options for external dispute resolution.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about progress of complaint resolution the options for external dispute resolution.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied progress(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about progress of a complaint the options for internal escalation.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about progress of a complaint the options for internal escalation.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied progress(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If after internal prioritisation and internal escalation the Consumer remains dissatisfied, the Supplier must tell the Consumer of the options for external dispute resolution, including the TIO.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: If after internal prioritisation and internal escalation the Consumer remains dissatisfied, the Supplier must tell the Consumer of the options for external dispute resolution, including the TIO.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied timeframe(X),escalation(X),internal prioritisation(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about timeframe for complaint resolution about the Supplier's internal escalation process.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about timeframe for complaint resolution about the Supplier's internal escalation process.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied timeframe(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about timeframe for complaint resolution about the Supplier's internal prioritisation process.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Supplier must inform a customer who is dissatisfied about timeframe for complaint resolution about the Supplier's internal prioritisation process.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer dissatisfied timeframe(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal prioritisation(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Complaint is Closed with the consent of the customer and the customer requests confirmation, the supplier must provide written confirmation of the resolution within 5 working days.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: Where a Complaint is Closed with the consent of the customer and the customer requests confirmation, the supplier must provide written confirmation of the resolution within 5 working days.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: close case(X),complaint(X),customer consent close case(X),customer request confirmation of resolution(X) => [OAPNP]provide confirmation resolution 5 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier must not close a complaint without consent from the customer, or complying with TCPC clauses 8.2.1.c, 8.2.1.d or 8.2.1.e
Rule.LegalRepresentation: The supplier must not close a complaint without consent from the customer, or complying with TCPC clauses 8.2.1.c, 8.2.1.d or 8.2.1.e
Rule.FormalRepresentation: => -close case(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier can close the complaint if it complies with TCPC clause 8.2.1.e (i.e. supplier is unable to contact the customer).
Rule.LegalRepresentation: only closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or if clauses 8.2.1.(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),complied821e(X) => [-OM]-close case(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier can close the complaint if it complies with TCPC clause 8.2.1.d i.e. complaint is deemed frivolous or vexatious and has been handled accordingly.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: only closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or if clauses 8.2.1.(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),escalation(X),frivolous or vexatious(X),inform reasons not to proceed(X),no further assistance(X) => [-OM]-close case(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier can close the complaint if it complies with TCPC clause 8.2.1.c (i.e. customer is dissatisfied with progress or outcome and has been informed of their options to escalate the issue).
Rule.LegalRepresentation: only closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or if clauses 8.2.1.(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),complied821c(X) => [-OM]-close case(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier can close the complaint if the customer consents to closing the complaint.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: only closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or if clauses 8.2.1.(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),customer consent close case(X) => [-OM]-close case(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: The supplier must not close a complaint without consent from the customer, or complying with TCPC clauses 8.2.1.c, 8.2.1.d or 8.2.1.e
Rule.LegalRepresentation: only closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or if clauses 8.2.1.(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X) => [OM]-close case(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If the supplier's actions to resolve a complaint are contingent on customer actions that are pending, the obligation to resolve the complaint within 10 working days is terminated
Rule.LegalRepresentation: completing all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Wokring Days of the Consumer's or former Customer's acceptance of that Resolution unless: the actions are contingent on actions by the Consumer or former Customer that have not been completed.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),pending customer action(X) => [-OAPNP]resolve 10 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must complete all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Working Days of the Customer's acceptance of that resolution unless previously a different resolution date was agreed with the customer.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: agreed custom resolution date(X),complaint(X) => [-OAPNP]resolve 10 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must complete all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered by the resolution date agreed with the customer.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: completing all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Working Days of the Customer's acceptance of that resolution unless: A. otherwise agreed with the customer; B. the actions are contingent on actions by the customer that have not been completed.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: agreed custom resolution date(X),complaint(X) => [OAPNP]resolve by custom date(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must complete all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Working Days of the Customer's acceptance of that resolution unless...
Rule.LegalRepresentation: completing all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Working Days of the Customer's acceptance of that resolution unless: A. otherwise agreed with the customer; B. the actions are contingent on actions by the customer that have not been completed.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),inform proposed resolution(X),offer accepted(X) => [OAPNP]resolve 10 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must advise Consumers in plain language of the Resolution of their Complaint, as soon as practicable after Supplier completes its investigation of the Complaint
Rule.LegalRepresentation: advising Consumers in plain language of the Resolution of their Complaint, as soon as practicable after Supplier completes its investigation of the Complaint
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),investigated(X) => [OAPNP]inform proposed resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must provide a means for the Consumer to monitor the Complaint's progress;
Rule.LegalRepresentation: providing a means for the Consumer to monitor the Complaint's progress;
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),complaint acknowledgment(X) => [OM]customer monitor progress(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must advise Consumers of any delays to promised timeframes
Rule.LegalRepresentation: advising Consumers of any delays to promised timeframes
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),delay in resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform delay(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: For urgent complaints, suppliers must implement the proposed resolution of the complaint within 2 working days after the complaint is received if the resolution is accepted by the customer.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: For Urgent Complaints, providing confirmation of the proposed Resolution of the urgent aspects of the Complaint and, if accepted by the Consumer, implementing the urgent aspects of the Resolution within 2 working days after the date the Complaint is received
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),offer accepted(X),urgent(X) => [OAPNP]implement resolution 2 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: For urgent complaints, suppliers must provide a proposed resolution of the complaint within 2 working days after the complaint is received.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: For Urgent Complaints, providing confirmation of the proposed Resolution of the urgent aspects of the Complaint and, if accepted by the Consumer, implementing the urgent aspects of the Resolution within 2 working days after the date the Complaint is received
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),urgent(X), complaint acknowledgment(X) => [OAPNP]inform proposed resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: the supplier is permitted not to inform of the customer of the proposed resolution if the supplier complied with 8.2.1.e in case of a no contact within the proposed timeframe
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complied821e(X) => [P]-inform proposed resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must inform customers of the proposed resolution within 15 days of receiving the complaint.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: advising the Consumer of the proposed Resolution of their Complaint within 15 Working Days from the date the Complaint is received in accordance with clause 8.2.1.a or as soon as practicable in all the circumstances
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X), complaint acknowledgment(X) => [OAPNP]inform proposed resolution 15 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: the supplier is permitted not to inform of the customer of the proposed resolution within 15 days if the supplier complied with 8.2.1.e in case of a no contact within the proposed timeframe
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complied821c(X) => [P]-inform proposed resolution 15 days(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: There is no mass disruption of service normally.
Rule.FormalRepresentation: => -declare mass disruption(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint if the anticipated delay is 10 Working Days or more and is not the result of a declared mass service disruption, advising the Consumer of their options for external dispute resolution including the TIO
Rule.LegalRepresentation: where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints) the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint if the anticipated delay is 10 Working Days or more and is not the result of a declared mass service disruption, advising the Consumer of their options for external dispute resolution including the TIO
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-declare mass disruption(X),-resolvable 2 days(X),urgent(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint if the anticipated delay is a further 10 Working Days or more and is not the result of a declared mass service disruption, advising the Consumer of their options for external dispute resolution including the TIO
Rule.LegalRepresentation: where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints) the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint if the anticipated delay is a further 10 Working Days or more and is not the result of a declared mass service disruption, advising the Consumer of their options for external dispute resolution including the TIO
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-declare mass disruption(X),-resolvable 25 days(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints the Supplier must advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint providing a revised timeframe for finalisation
Rule.LegalRepresentation: where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints) the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint providing a revised timeframe for finalisation
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-resolvable 2 days(X),urgent(X) => [OAPNP]inform timeframe for resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days the Supplier must advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint providing a revised timeframe for finalisation
Rule.LegalRepresentation: where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints) the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint providing a revised timeframe for finalisation
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-resolvable 15 days(X) => [OAPNP]inform timeframe for resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints the Supplier must advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint the reasons for the delay
Rule.LegalRepresentation: where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints) the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint the reasons for the delay
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-resolvable 2 days(X),urgent(X) => [OAPNP]inform reasons delay(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days the Supplier must advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint the reasons for the delay
Rule.LegalRepresentation: where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for Urgent Complaints) the Supplier must, advise the Customer as soon as practicable after receiving the Complaint the reasons for the delay
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X),-resolvable 15 days(X) => [OAPNP]inform reasons delay(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: If the complaint is indicative of a general problem, the root cause of the problem must be addressed as part of resolution.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: where the Complaints are indicative of a wider problem or issue, addressing the root cause of the problem or issue;
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint on topic(X),complaint topic indicative of general problem(X),remedy for general problem(X) => [OAPP]implement remedy for general problem(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Suppliers must tailoring any remedy offered to address the individual circumstances of the Consumer
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: tailoring any remedy offered to address the root cause of the Complaint and to address the individual circumstances of the Consumer
Rule.FormalRepresentation: customer advise special circumstance(X),remedy for special circumstance(X) => [OAPNP]offer remedy special circumstance(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must tailor any remedy offered to address the root cause of the complaint.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: tailoring any remedy offered to address the root cause of the Complaint and to address the individual circumstances of the Consumer
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint on topic(X),remedy for topic(X) => [OAPNP]offer remedy(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must ensure that relevant staff are made aware of potential remedies available to resolve a complaint.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including ensuring relevant staff are aware of the potential remedies available to Resolve a Complaint
Rule.FormalRepresentation: relevant staff(X) => [OM]aware possible resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Suppliers must implement a process for identification and management of urgent complaints, including checking if each complaint is urgent.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: implementing a process for the identification and management of Urgent Complaints
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X) => [OAPNP]check if urgent complaint(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Suppliers must attempt to resolve a complaint on first contact.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: where possible, seeking to Resolve a Complaint on first contact
Rule.FormalRepresentation: immediate resolution available(X) => [OANPNP]immediate resolution(X),[OAPP]escalation(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Suppliers must attempt to resolve a complaint on first contact by checking for immediate resolution.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: where possible, seeking to Resolve a Complaint on first contact
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X), -no contact(X) => [OAPNP]check immediate resolution(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must acknowledge complaints raised by phone immediately.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: acknowledging Complaints: immediately where the Complaint is made in person or by telephone;
Rule.FormalRepresentation: call from complaint number(X),contact staff(X) => [OAPNP]immediate complaint acknowledgment(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must acknowledge a complaint within 2 working days where the complaint is made via email, being logged via the Supplierâ€™s website or another website endorsed by the Supplier for that purpose; post but a posted response is not requested; telephone and a message is recorded without direct contact with a staff member of the Supplier
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: acknowledging Complaints: within 2 Working Days where the Complaint is made by: email; being logged via the Supplierâ€™s website or another website endorsed by the Supplier for that purpose; post but a posted response is not requested; telephone and a message is recorded without direct contact with a staff member of the Supplier
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint(X), -no contact(X) => [OAPNP]complaint acknowledgment 2 working day(X)

Rule.ControlObjective: Supplier must acknowledge complaints raised in person immediately.
Rule.LegalRepresentation: A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: acknowledging Complaints: immediately where the Complaint is made in person or by telephone;
Rule.FormalRepresentation: complaint in person(X) => [OAPNP]immediate complaint acknowledgment(X)
